review.title: Data Stream Clustering: Challenges and Issues
review.abstract: Very large databases are required to store massive amounts of data that are continuously inserted and queried. Analyzing huge data sets and extracting valuable pattern in many applications are interesting for researchers. We can identify two main groups of techniques for huge data bases mining. One group refers to streaming data and applies mining techniques whereas second group attempts to solve this problem directly with efficient algorithms. Recently many researchers have focused on data stream as an efficient strategy against huge data base mining instead of mining on entire data base. The main problem in data stream mining means evolving data is more difficult to detect in this techniques therefore unsupervised methods should be applied. However, clustering techniques can lead us to discover hidden information. In this survey, we try to clarify: first, the different problem definitions related to data stream clustering in general; second, the specific difficulties encountered in this field of research; third, the varying assumptions, heuristics, and intuitions forming the basis of different approaches; and how several prominent solutions tackle different problems. Index Terms- Data Stream, Clustering, K-Means, Concept drift

metadata.title: Data Stream Clustering: Challenges and Issues

sections.heading: II. GAPS
sections.text: (The architectural aspects of data stream processing have received considerable attention, but most efforts focus on the mining and clustering aspects of the problem. Algorithms suffer from the ability to handle difficult clustering tasks without supervision. For example, there are no assumptions about the number of clusters in the data stream, but in most methods this parameter should be determined. The algorithms required expert wizards in the form of the number of expected partitions or the expected density of clusters. They are required to re-learn recurring patterns. Compactness and separation of the data are the most important problems in the quality of clustering. Accuracy in terms of detecting concept drift. Efficiency in terms of speed is a critical problem when data mining clusters clusters. Previous approaches lack precision in detecting outsiders. Uncertain data: in most applications we do not have sufficient data for statistical operations, so new methods are needed to manage unsafe data streams more quickly and efficiently.

sections.heading: IV. DATA STREAM CLUSTERING METHODS
sections.text: This year it is more than ever before.

sections.heading: V. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: In this paper, we have identified some difficulties in clustering data streams. Most applications of data streams are large dimensions, and new methods need to be developed for this purpose. Furthermore, concept drift is the nature of the data stream and should be managed by new methods. On the other hand, the data stream is similar to a flow: data comes in and out, so we need to design efficient algorithms while we need to scan data once and extract hidden patterns from it. Data development, one-time visits to data, and space constraints are important problems when clustering data streams. There are some primitive methods that concretize the framework for processing data streams, but developing a new framework with different features than the previous one (e.g. using genetic algorithm, ant colony algorithm, and neural networks) can lead us to more effective structures.

referenceMentions.context: Many studies have been executed to support data stream mining especially for concept drift[1, 2].
Many studies have been executed to support data stream mining especially for concept drift[1, 2].
Many researcher’s interest is to apply some techniques for increasing compactness of representation, fast and incremental processing of new data points, clear and fast identification of outliers[3].
BIRCH can be considered a primitive method in this area [4].
STREAM is the next main method which has been designed especially for data stream clustering [5].
Recently a novel feature-based method for clustering numeric data streams which employes feature selections has been proposed[6].
CluStream addresses these two concerns [7].
In absence of certainty accuracy descend so [8] proposed the UMicro algorithm for clustering uncertain data streams.
Moreover, several methods have been proposed to speed up K - means [9, 10] and they can be leveraged for data stream clustering.
Moreover, several methods have been proposed to speed up K - means [9, 10] and they can be leveraged for data stream clustering.

A spherical K – means SPKMEANS was introduced to address high - dimensional and sparse data objects, particularly for document clustering, which uses a concept vector containing semantic information to represent each cluster [11].
The SPKMEANS algorithm is further cast into the framework of a maximum likelihood estimation of a mixture of K von Mises - Fisher distributions[12].
Finding a globally optimal partition of a given set of documents has been studied and a novel algorithm proposed which is named HKA [13].
Modified global K-Means algorithm which is effective for solving clustering problems in gene expression is applied for avoiding local optimal problem [14].
Fractal Clustering defines clusters as sets of point that exhibit self-similarity [15].
[16] Proposed a new algorithm to handle data stream based on fractal concept.
COBWEB is an incremental clustering technique intends to discover understandable patterns in data [17].
[18] Proposed a new method base on density clustering to group web pages.
A framework base on CluStream to cluster massive text and categorical data has been developed [19].
Density-Based clustering has been leveraged in data stream [20].
[21] Extend semantic smoothing model into the text data streams context and present an extended semantic smoothing model.
[23] Illustrated a two level divide - and - conquer clustering algorithm applied to a data set with 2,000 data points.
[25] Has improved K-Means method by using divide and conquer.
Recently [26] have developed a connectivity based reprehensive points to cluster data stream.
[27] Developed a weighted fuzzy CMeans algorithm for data stream.
[28] Pay more attention to the points detected as outliers and give them a chance of survival in the next incoming chunk of data, rather declare them outlier by observing the current chunk.
One group of researchers has concentrated on static high dimensional datasets [29-33] whereas others pay attention to high dimensional data stream clustering.
One group of researchers has concentrated on static high dimensional datasets [29-33] whereas others pay attention to high dimensional data stream clustering.
One group of researchers has concentrated on static high dimensional datasets [29-33] whereas others pay attention to high dimensional data stream clustering.
One group of researchers has concentrated on static high dimensional datasets [29-33] whereas others pay attention to high dimensional data stream clustering.
One group of researchers has concentrated on static high dimensional datasets [29-33] whereas others pay attention to high dimensional data stream clustering.
One of the most popular researches is HPStream [34] that uses the projected clustering approach in order to cluster high dimensional data stream.
